attributes.action: stop penalising the honest hardworking members of the british public, following yet more increases in the Budget of 2008
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In the past year, I received a pay award equivalent to £2.50 a week as a Civil Servant. This is despite my workload increasing due to Civil Service reform / cuts. 

However, my cost of living has increased dramatically more than £2.50.

I am saddened by the fact that despite me working continually since I left school 12 years ago, making a conscious decision not to have children before I could financially support them myself, I am in no way rewarded for my sensible approach by the UK government. 

Indeed, I am left with the feeling that not only am I unrewarded as a Civil Servant, but I would also be better off having had a number of children and refusing to work. 

I request that the Prime Minister takes prompt action to reward such citizens that do not receive any support in living an honest life on a modest income, and are struggling now to support themselves with the increased cost of living faced by people in the UK today

reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
